objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK's National Cyber Security Centre. NCSC is the author and publisher of this report, providing analysis, detection strategies, and YARA signatures.

objects.name: DAMASCENED PEACOCK C2 domain
objects.description: Command and Control (C2) domain used by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to communicate with attacker infrastructure over HTTP.

objects.name: Malware download domain
objects.description: Domain used to serve DAMASCENED PEACOCK payload during infection chain.

objects.name: DAMASCENED PEACOCK download URL
objects.description: Malicious URL in spear-phishing campaign, used to download the DAMASCENED PEACOCK malware.

objects.name: Third stage DLL payload
objects.description: Location where DAMASCENED PEACOCK writes the downloaded third stage DLL before launching via COM Hijack.

objects.name: COM Hijack Persistence Registry Key
objects.description: Registry key abused by DAMASCENED PEACOCK for persistence via COM hijacking. Malware replaces this entry to launch its payload.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious first stage downloader (original filename: PortDocFormat.exe) used in spear-phishing.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious first stage downloader (original filename: PortDocFormat.exe) used in spear-phishing.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious first stage downloader (original filename: PortDocFormat.exe) used in spear-phishing.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL payload (second stage).

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL payload (second stage).

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the DAMASCENED PEACOCK DLL payload (second stage).

objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows systems, delivered via spear-phishing. It acts as the second of three stages in the infection chain, responsible for downloading the final stage and executing it through COM Hijack. It employs defense evasion techniques such as XOR-based string obfuscation and dynamic API resolution, communicates over HTTP to a C2 domain (apimonger.com), and is code signed. DAMASCENED PEACOCK operates as a 32-bit DLL with a single export, and persists via registry manipulation for COM hijacking.

objects.name: romcom
objects.description: RomCom is a broader malware family of which DAMASCENED PEACOCK, RustyClaw, and SnipBot are part. RomCom campaigns employ code signed first stages and contain multiple malware variants.

objects.name: rustyclaw
objects.description: RustyClaw is a malware variant related to DAMASCENED PEACOCK, forming an earlier stage in the infection chain documented by Talos and part of the RomCom family.

objects.name: snipbot
objects.description: SnipBot is a malware variant related to DAMASCENED PEACOCK and part of the RomCom family, documented by Palo Alto Networks.

objects.name: dustyhammock
objects.description: DustyHammock is referenced as the final stage in the infection chain following DAMASCENED PEACOCK and is part of the RomCom malware ecosystem.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: Cisco Talos is cited as a source documenting the RustyClaw malware variant.

objects.name: Palo Alto Networks
objects.description: Palo Alto Networks (Unit 42) is cited as a source documenting the SnipBot malware variant.

objects.name: MOD
objects.description: UK Ministry of Defence. The MOD was a target of the spear-phishing campaign which delivered DAMASCENED PEACOCK and detected the attack.

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: FUTURICO LLC is the organization to which the code signing certificate used for the first stage of the malware is issued. Mentioned in the code signing certificate details.

objects.name: Unknown (RomCom threat actor)
objects.description: The actor behind DAMASCENED PEACOCK and related RomCom campaigns. The actor demonstrates access to code signing certificates, delivers multi-stage Windows malware via spear-phishing, and leverages defense evasion techniques and staged malware delivery.

objects.name: T1592
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32-bit or 64-bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: T1566.002
objects.description: Phishing with spearphishing links: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: T1204.002
objects.description: User Execution via malicious file or link: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage which is reliant upon the user running the file.

objects.name: T1559.001
objects.description: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model - DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the third stage it downloads by COM Hijacking explorer.exe.

objects.name: T1140
objects.description: Obfuscated Files or Information: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings used throughout.

objects.name: T1027.007
objects.description: Obfuscated Files or Information: Dynamic API Resolution - DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs to obfuscate functionality.

objects.name: T1553.002
objects.description: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing - The first stage of the malware is signed, meaning DAMASCENED PEACOCK executes within a signed, malicious process.

objects.name: T1036
objects.description: Masquerading - The first stage of DAMASCENED PEACOCK is an executable with an icon and filename indicating it is a PDF.

objects.name: T1071.001
objects.description: Command and Control: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols - DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with the command and control server over HTTP.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve
APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76"

    strings:

    $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1

C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3}
    condition:

    (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

and all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED
PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from
a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK
used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants
used to generate the hash."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ =
{8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9
??85F6}
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the original name and export
name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll"
        $ = "DllExport"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
